title: Notable & Quotable: Merkel on Trump’s Twitter Ban
sub_head: ‘The freedom of opinion is a fundamental right.’
body:
From a Jan. 11 Associated Press dispatch:

German Chancellor Angela Merkel considers U.S. President Donald Trump’s eviction from Twitter by the company “problematic.” . . .
Merkel’s spokesman, Steffen Seibert, said the operators of social media platforms “bear great responsibility for political communication not being poisoned by hatred, by lies and by incitement to violence.” . . .
But Seibert also said that the freedom of opinion is a fundamental right of “elementary significance.”
